functions.name: delegate
functions.desc:
Ask a capable helper for help looking up a piece of information or performing an action.
Do not simply repeat what the user said as instructions.
You should use this to break up complex user queries into multiple simpler steps.
NOTE: Helpers cannot see previous parts of your conversation.

instructions.description: Detailed instructions on what your helper should do to help you.

msg.content: Of both current and former members of South Korean boy band Astro, how many members were born in March?

<document>
<title>Astro (South Korean band)</title>
<fragment>
South Korean boy band



| Astro

**Astro** (Korean: 아스트로; stylized in all caps) is a South Korean boy band formed by Fantagio.[1] The group is composed of four members: MJ, Jinjin, Cha Eun-woo, and Yoon San-ha.[2] Originally a six-piece group, Rocky departed from the group on February 28, 2023,[3] and Moonbin died on April 19, 2023.[4] They debuted on February 23, 2016, with the extended play *Spring Up* and were subsequently named as one of the best new K-pop acts of 2016 by *Billboard*.[5]




## Career[edit]


</fragment>
<fragment>
9. **^** Jeong So-young (November 23, 2015). 아스트로(ASTRO), 팬들 위한 '월간 팬미팅' 화제… '이번 달은 포옹, 다음 달은?' [ASTRO's 'monthly fan meeting' is a hot topic amongst fans... "This month a hug, and next month?"]. *Top Star News* (in Korean). Archived from the original on March 4, 2023. Retrieved March 5, 2023.
10. **^** Park Hye-mi (November 30, 2015). 아스트로(ASTRO), 전국 6개 도시 돌며 윙카 공연 펼쳤다…‘성공적’ [ASTRO toured through 6 cities across the country in an advertisement truck... 'Successful']. *Top Star News* (in Korean). Archived from the original on March 4, 2023. Retrieved March 5, 2023.
11. **^** Lee Jung-hyeok (February 16, 2016). 신인 그룹 아스트로, 데뷔 앨범 'Spring Up' 하이라이트 메들리 영상 공개 [Rookie group Astro, debut album 'Spring Up' highlight medley video release]. *Sports Chosun* (in Korean). Archived from the original on March 4, 2023. Retrieved March 5, 2023.

</fragment>
<fragment>
29. **^** Son Ye-ji (October 17, 2016). 아스트로, 日 도쿄 달궜다… 첫 해외 쇼케이스 성료 [ASTRO heated up Tokyo, Japan... Successful completion of the first overseas showcase]. *Hankyung News* (in Korean). Archived from the original on March 7, 2023. Retrieved March 8, 2023.
30. **^** Jang Kyung-guk (October 24, 2016). 아스트로, 인도네시아 공연 성황리 개최… 현지 팬 '들썩' [Astro successfully held a concert in Indonesia... Local fans 'excited']. *Sports Donga* (in Korean). Archived from the original on March 7, 2023. Retrieved March 8, 2023.
31. **^** Son Ye-ji (August 3, 2016). 아스트로, 태국 쇼케이스 개최 "亞 투어 고려 중" [ASTRO to hold showcase in Thailand "Considering a tour in Thailand"]. *Hankyung News* (in Korean). Archived from the original on March 7, 2023. Retrieved March 8, 2023.
32. **^** Yoon Jun-pil (October 31, 2016). 아스트로, 이번엔 '가을 소년'이다...추억 속 첫사랑男 변신 [Astro, this time it's 'Autumn Boy'... Remembering the boy that became my first love]. *Hankyung News* (in Korean). Archived from the original on March 7, 2023. Retrieved March 8, 2023.

48. **^** Tamar Herman (January 3, 2018). "Astro & Weki Meki's Label Fantagio Corp. Faces Strike After CEO's Firing". *Billboard*. Archived from the original on March 11, 2023. Retrieved March 11, 2023.

50. **^** Kim Hyo-jin (August 2, 2018). 아스트로(ASTRO), 일본 나고야 '아스트로드' 공연 후 단체샷 공개…"시작부터 잘 풀려" [Astro releases a group photo after their 'ASTROAD' performance in Nagoya, Japan... "It's been going well from the start"]. *Top Star News* (in Korean). Archived from the original on March 11, 2023. Retrieved March 11, 2023.

</fragment>
<fragment>
25. **^** Tamar Herman (May 20, 2016). "DEAN, ASTRO Added to KCON USA Lineup". *Billboard*. Archived from the original on August 3, 2016. Retrieved March 8, 2023.
26. **^** Yoo Ji-hoon (August 12, 2016). 아스트로, '썸머바이브' 활동 마무리…“노력하는 성장돌 될 것” [Astro wraps up 'Summer Vibes' activities... "I will grow as an idol by working hard"]. *MBN* (in Korean). Archived from the original on March 8, 2023. Retrieved March 8, 2023.
27. ^ ***a*** ***b*** Han In-gu (July 20, 2016). 아스트로, 데뷔 5개월만에 단독콘서트 개최 [Astro to hold a solo concert 5 months after their debut]. *Daily News* (in Korean). Archived from the original on August 19, 2017. Retrieved March 8, 2023 – via Naver.
28. **^** Seong Jeong-eun (July 27, 2016). 아스트로, 미니라이브 '땡스 아로하' 티켓 예매 27일 오픈 [Astro, mini live 'Thankx Aroha' ticket reservation opens on the 27th]. *SPOTV News* (in Korean). Archived from the original on March 7, 2023. Retrieved March 8, 2023.

<fragment>
40. **^** Kim Ji-woong (May 29, 2017). 아스트로(ASTRO), 첫 단독 콘서트 '아스트로드 투 서울' 포스터 깜짝 공개…‘기대감 UP’ [Astro, a surprise poster for their first solo concert 'Astroad to Seoul'... 'Expectations are UP']. *Top Star News* (in Korean). Archived from the original on March 11, 2023. Retrieved March 11, 2023.
41. ^ ***a*** ***b*** Song Song-i (August 30, 2017). 아스트로, 첫 日단독 콘서트 성료…퍼포먼스·소통·팬사랑 3박자 [Astro successfully completed their first solo concert in Japan... 3 times of performances, communication, and love for fans]. *Sports Kyunghyang* (in Korean). Archived from the original on March 11, 2023. Retrieved March 11, 2023.
42. **^** Tamar Herman (November 1, 2017). "Astro Returns With Smooth New 'Crazy Sexy Cool' Video". *Billboard*. Archived from the original on December 4, 2017. Retrieved March 11, 2023.

</fragment>
<fragment>
33. **^** Kim Soo-kyung (November 1, 2016). 아스트로, 단독 리얼리티 '아스트로 프로젝트 : 아.시.아' 주인공 낙점 [ASTRO, solo reality show 'Astro Project A.S.I.A.']. *Hankyung News* (in Korean). Archived from the original on March 7, 2023. Retrieved March 8, 2023.
34. **^** Hyeon Ji-min (February 22, 2017). 아스트로, '윈터 드림' 공개...사계절 프로젝트 완성 [Astro unveils 'Winter Dream'... End of the four seasons project]. *Hankyung News* (in Korean). Archived from the original on March 11, 2023. Retrieved March 11, 2023.
35. **^** Kim Hyun-deok (March 23, 2017). [HD테마] 같이 벚꽃놀이 가고싶은 아이돌…'방탄소년단(BTS) 진- 엑소(EXO) 백현-아스트로(ASTRO) 차은우' ② [[HD Theme] Idols that you'd want to go view cherry blossoms with... 'Jin (BTS) - Baehyun (EXO) - Cha Eun-woo (ASTRO)' ②]. *Top Star News* (in Korean). Archived from the original on March 11, 2023. Retrieved March 11, 2023.

</fragment>
<fragment>

After their web drama finished airing, the group started the "Meet U" project. As part of the project, Astro traveled through South Korea, covering songs in front of crowds and holding fan meetings. Along with the performances, a KakaoTalk Plus Friends account was set up. Fantagio stated that once the group had gathered 10,000 friends on the app, they would announce their official debut date.[9] The goal was met by December 2015.[10] Their debut showcase, held on January 28, 2016, was sold out in under a minute and far exceeded the original limit of 1,000 attendants.[11][12] There, they also announced their official fan club name, Aroha.


They also appeared in their own reality TV show titled *Astro OK! Ready*, which began airing on January 21, 2016, on MBC every1[13] and concluded on February 18, 2016.[14]



### 2016: Debut with *Spring Up* and rising popularity[edit]


</fragment>
</document>

<document>
<title>Cha Eun-woo</title>
<fragment>

**Lee Dong-min** (Korean: 이동민; born March 30, 1997), known professionally as **Cha Eun-woo** (차은우), is a South Korean singer and actor under the label Fantagio. He is a member of the South Korean boy band Astro.




## Early life[edit]


Cha Eun-woo was born on March 30, 1997 in the city of Gunpo, Gyeonggi Province.[2][3][4] He attended Suri Middle School and Suri High School before graduating from Hanlim Multi Art School in 2016.[5] He studied at Sungkyunkwan University, majoring in performing arts in the theater department.[6]



## Career[edit]


### 2013–2015: Career beginnings[edit]


Cha debuted as an actor in 2014 with a minor role in the film *My Brilliant Life*.[7] He was the fourth trainee to be officially introduced with the Fantagio iTeen Photo Test Cut. In August 2015, Cha, along with the other members of Astro, participated in the web-drama *To Be Continued*.[8]



### 2016–present: Debut with Astro, solo activities and rising popularity[edit]


See also: Astro (South Korean band)

## Awards and nominations[edit]

130. **^** 세상을 바꿀 수 있는 힘 브랜드에 있다. *Naver* (in Korean). September 3, 2023. Archived from the original on September 4, 2023. Retrieved September 4, 2023.
131. **^** "ASTROs Cha Eun Woo bags The HallyuTalk Star of the Year Award: Fans celebrate Island actors incredible work". *Pinkvilla*. August 25, 2023. Archived from the original on November 16, 2018. Retrieved September 12, 2023.
132. **^** "Indonesian Television Awards Malam Ini, Ada Cha Eun Woo ASTRO! Ini 5 Fakta Si Face Genius". *Tribun News* (in Indonesian). October 31, 2018. Archived from the original on November 16, 2018. Retrieved November 16, 2018.
133. **^** Jeon, Aram (October 2, 2018). [종합] '2018 KDA' 유동근, 대상 영예…'같이 살래요' 4관왕 '쾌거' [[Comprehensive] '2018 KDA' Dong Keun Lee, Grand Prize 'Let's live together' 4 crowns 'comfort']. *Xports News* (in Korean). Archived from the original on March 31, 2019. Retrieved October 2, 2018 – via Naver.

</fragment>
<fragment>

In November 2018, Cha was included as one of GQ Korea's Men of the Year.[20] In 2019, he ranked seventh—with 44,178,474 points—in the Most Accumulated Points On Male Idol Brand Reputation.[78][*unreliable source?*] In the K-pop Radar Year-End Chart of 2019, Cha was named as the male "Hot Instagrammer".[79]


In April 2021, Cha placed 17th on *Forbes* Korea Power Celebrity and sixth in the SNS category.[80] In April 2022, after Cha was selected to represent contemporary men's clothing brand Liberclassy,[55] traffic to the company's mall increased by 806% in the first week of April from the previous week, and the brand also saw an increase in social media engagement.[81] An official from Liberclassy said, "The Cha Eunwoo effect was seen as more than 70 million won in sales generated for pre-application alone".[82]



## Discography[edit]


See also: Astro (South Korean band) § Discography




</fragment>
</document>

## Notes[edit]


1. **^** "24 Hours" did not enter the Gaon Digital Chart, but appeared at number 90 on the component Download Chart.[16]
2. **^** "Wish" did not enter the Circle Digital Chart, but appeared at number 17 on the component Download Chart.[17]

## References[edit]


</fragment>
<fragment>

Yoon San-ha was born on March 21, 2000. He graduated from Hanlim Multi Art School in 2019.[2]


He is the youngest in his family. Sanha has 2 older brothers: Jun-ha and Je-ha.[3]



## Career[edit]


### 2013–15: Career beginnings[edit]


Yoon was accepted as a Fantagio iTeen trainee on December 16, 2012. He was the third trainee to be officially introduced with the Fantagio iTeen Photo Test Cut.[*citation needed*]


In August 2015, Yoon along with the other members of his group participated in the web-drama *To Be Continued*.[4]



### 2016–present: Debut with Astro, Solo activities[edit]


Main article: Astro (South Korean band)

Yoon debuted as part of the six-member group Astro on February 23, 2016, with the mini album *Spring Up*.[*citation needed*]


In July 2018, Yoon was chosen as a host for the teenager-focused talk show *Yogobara*. He hosted alongside GFriend's Umji.[5]


In July 2019, Yoon and MJ were confirmed to be the MCs of the TVN D's variety talk show *Blanket Kick at Night.*[6]


</fragment>

<fragment>

Moonbin began his journey with Fantagio as a trainee in fifth grade, eventually transitioning to a full-fledged trainee during his middle school years. He actively took part in the company's boy group project iTeen, and he was introduced through the Fantagio iTeen Photo Test Cut.[6] Before his official debut with Astro, Moonbin and his fellow group members starred in a web-drama titled "*To Be Continued"*.[7]



### 2016–2022: Debut with Astro, solo activities, and unit debut[edit]

msg.content:
Here are the birth dates of all current and former members of the South Korean boy band Astro:

### Current Members:
1. **MJ**: No specific birth date found in the search results.
2. **Jinjin**: No specific birth date found in the search results.

msg.content:
<document>
<title>MJ (South Korean singer)</title>
<fragment>

**Kim Myung-jun** (Korean: 김명준; March 5, 1994), known professionally as **MJ** (엠제이), is a South Korean singer and actor managed under the label of Fantagio. He debuted in 2016 as the main vocalist of the South Korean six-member boy group Astro. In August 2020, he debuted as one of the five members of an idol trot group named Super Five through MBC TV's reality trot show *Favorite Entertainment*.




## Life and career[edit]


### 2012–2015: Pre-debut[edit]


MJ was a contestant in the 2012 JYP Entertainment X HUM Audition and won a one-year scholarship from Seoul Arts College.[1]


MJ took part in Fantagio's iTeen, a rookie talent development program managed under the label of Fantagio. He and other members of Astro were known as iTeen Boys.


MJ along with the other members of Astro starred in a web drama series named "To be Continued" which featured the members as themselves.[2]



### 2016–2019: Debut with Astro and solo activities[edit]


See also: Astro (South Korean band)


</fragment>
<fragment>
MJ officially debuted as a member of Astro on February 23, 2016.


During Astro's 2nd ASTROAD To Seoul "Starlight" concert which was held on December 22–23, 2018, MJ performed his solo trot stage "Cheok Cheok".[3] It was included in the DVD of the concert which was released in June 2019.[4]


In February 2019, MJ sang his first OST titled "You're My Everything" for the Korean drama, *My Only One*.[5]


Also in February 2019, MJ along with Jin Ju, Hyomin, Heo Kyung-hwan, Kang Tae-oh travelled to Nha Trang for the Korean travel show "Have To Go to Know".[6]


In March 2019, MJ and Jinjin took part in the travel/variety show project of Celuv TV - *Go Together, Travel Alone*.[7] The show was filmed in Saipan and includes Tony Ahn, Han Seung-yeon, Jin Jin and Kim So-hye. It was later on released in a DVD format.


In June 2019, he co-hosted Insane Quiz Show Season 2, also abbreviated as "이세퀴" and "IQS S2", with BtoB's Illhoon and Loona's Chuu.[8]


</fragment>
<fragment>
23. **^** Ahn, Yoon-ji (April 10, 2022). "아스트로 MJ, 5월 9일 군악대 입대 "건강히 돌아올 것"[전문]" [ASTRO MJ to enlist in the military band on May 9 - "I will come back healthy"]. *Star News Korea* (in Korean). Archived from the original on April 9, 2022. Retrieved April 10, 2022 – via Naver.
24. **^** Son, Jin-ah (November 8, 2023). "아스트로 MJ, 만기 전역…오늘(8일)부터 팬 만난다 [MK★이슈]" [Astro MJ, expiration of discharge… Meet fans starting today (8th) [MK★Issue]]. *MK Sports* (in Korean). Retrieved November 8, 2023 – via Naver.
25. **^** "Get Set Yo". *Gaon Music Chart* (in Korean). Archived from the original on November 11, 2021. Retrieved November 11, 2021.
26. **^** "아스트로 MJ, '더 트롯쇼' 1위..솔로 데뷔곡 '계세요'로 트로트 샛별증" [ASTRO MJ, 1st place on 'The Trot Show'... Proving the trot star with 'Get Set Yo' with his solo debut song]. *OSEN*. November 30, 2021. Archived from the original on November 30, 2021. Retrieved November 30, 2021.

</fragment>
<fragment>

On November 3, MJ debuted as a solo artist with two songs — "Get Set Yo" and "Valet Parking".[20] On November 29, he won in SBS's The Trot Show and is the first idol to ever win first place on The Trot Show.[21]



## Personal life[edit]


On February 3, 2022, the agency confirmed that MJ would temporarily suspend his activities due to illness.[22]



### Military service[edit]


MJ enlisted in the military band as part of his mandatory military service on May 9, 2022.[23] He was discharged from military service on November 8, 2023.[24]



## Discography[edit]


See also: Astro (South Korean band) § Discography




</fragment>
<fragment>
18. **^** "아스트로 MJ·라키·한기찬, G마켓 글로벌샵 웹드 '숨은 그놈' 출연". *싱글리스트* (in Korean). 2021-10-28. Archived from the original on 2021-10-31. Retrieved 2021-10-31.
19. **^** "G마켓 글로벌샵, 웹드라마 '숨은 그 놈 찾기'로 K-컬처 붐 잇는다". *Financial News*. October 28, 2021. Archived from the original on October 31, 2021. Retrieved October 31, 2021.
20. ^ ***a*** ***b*** Park, Se-yeon. "아스트로 MJ 트로트 가수 데뷔…영탁 프로듀싱" [ASTRO MJ trot singer debut... Young Tak Producer]. *Naver* (in Korean). Archived from the original on 2021-11-03. Retrieved 2021-11-03.
21. **^** "아스트로 MJ, '더 트롯쇼' 1위..솔로 데뷔곡 '계세요'로 트로트 샛별 입증". *OSEN*. Archived from the original on November 30, 2021. Retrieved November 30, 2021.
22. **^** Lee Min-ji (February 3, 2022). "아스트로 MJ 건강문제로 활동 중단 "휴식과 치료 필요"(공식)" [ASTRO MJ Suspension of activities due to health problems “Needs rest and treatment” (official)] (in Korean). Newsen. Archived from the original on March 13, 2023. Retrieved February 3, 2022 – via Naver.

msg.content:
<document>
<title>Jinjin</title>
<fragment>
### 2016-2021: Debut with Astro and solo activities[edit]


Main article: Astro (South Korean band)

Jinjin debuted as part of the 6-member boy group Astro on February 23, 2016.[4] Their first EP *Spring Up* has five songs including the title track "Hide & Seek".[4] In July 2016, Jinjin was featured in Eric Nam's song "Can't Help Myself" performance stages.[5]


In November 2018, Jinjin was featured in tvN Asia's "Wok the World". Jinjin joined the cast in Hong Kong.[6][*unreliable source?*] During Astro's "2nd ASTROAD To Seoul "Starlight"" concert which was last held on December 22–23, 2018, Jinjin performed "Mad Max" which he also composed.[7] It was included in the DVD of the concert which was released in June 2019.[8]


</fragment>
<fragment>

**Park Jin-woo** (Korean: 박진우; born March 15, 1996), better known by his stage name **Jinjin** (Hangul: 진진), is a South Korean rapper, dancer, singer, and composer.[1] He debuted as the leader of the South Korean boy group Astro on February 23, 2016, under the label Fantagio. He was also a member of the duo Jinjin & Rocky until its disbandment from bandmate Rocky's departure due to not renewing his contract.




## Early life[edit]


Jinjin was born on March 15, 1996, in Seoul, South Korea. He attended and graduated from Hanlim Multi Art School with a focus on Practical Dance.[2] He attended NY Dance Academy in Ilsan and participated in various dance competitions.



## Career[edit]


### 2015: Pre-debut[edit]


Jinjin was a trainee for 2 years in Fantagio before debuting with Astro. He was the 5th trainee to be officially introduced with the Fantagio iTeen Photo Test Cut. Before their debut, Jinjin along with the other 5 members of Astro had starred in a web-drama To Be Continued.[3]




</fragment>

<document>
<title>Rocky (singer)</title>
<fragment>

Rocky was born on February 25, 1999, in Jinju, South Gyeongsang Province, South Korea.[4] He attended and graduated from Hanlim Multi Art School with a focus on Practical Music.[5]


He has a younger brother, Jeonggeun, who is a member of the boy group Haww under Biscuit Entertainment.[6][7]



## Career[edit]


### 2010–2015: Pre debut[edit]


In 2010 in the fifth grade of elementary school, Rocky participated in the audition for the musical *Billy Elliot*.[8] In the same year, he became trainee under Fantagio Music.[9]


Rocky had been a contestant of *Korea's Got Talent* in 2011.[10]


Rocky was the first trainee who has been introduced into i-Teen project, *Lotte World Rising Start Concert.*[11]


Before their debut, Rocky along with the other 5 members of Astro starred in a web-series *To Be Continued*.[12]



### 2016–2021: Debut with Astro and solo activities[edit]


Main article: Astro (South Korean band)

<fragment>

**Park Min-hyuk** (Korean: 박민혁; born February 25, 1999), profesionally known as **Rocky** (Korean: 라키), is a South Korean singer-songwriter, rapper, dancer, composer, and actor. Rocky debuted as a member of the South Korean boy group Astro in 2016. Apart from his group's activities, Rocky has also starred in various drama series such as  *Soul Plate* (2019),  *Find Me If You Can* (2021),  *Hyangjeon of Youth* (2021), and *Broke Rookie Star* (2022). Additionally, he also played in the Korean interpretation of the musical drama *The Three Musketeers* (2022).


On February 28, 2023, following the contract discussion since late December 2022,[1] it was confirmed that Rocky decided to not renew his contract with Fantagio and departed from Astro.[2] In afterwards, he started to build his own agency named One Fine Day Entertainment.[3]




## Early life[edit]

<title>Moonbin</title>

</fragment>
<fragment>

Moonbin began his journey with Fantagio as a trainee in fifth grade, eventually transitioning to a full-fledged trainee during his middle school years. He actively took part in the company's boy group project iTeen, and he was introduced through the Fantagio iTeen Photo Test Cut.[6] Before his official debut with Astro, Moonbin and his fellow group members starred in a web-drama titled "*To Be Continued"*.[7]



### 2016–2022: Debut with Astro, solo activities, and unit debut[edit]


Main article: Astro (South Korean band)


</fragment>
<fragment>
![](image)Moonbin during the 2019 S/S Hera Seoul Fashion Week on October 19, 2018
Moonbin debuted as part of the six-member boy group Astro on February 23, 2016. Their debut extended play, *Spring Up*, contained five songs, including the lead single "Hide & Seek".[8] In 2018, Moonbin joined the cast of *The Ultimate Watchlist of Latest Trends*, participating in the first two seasons.[9][10] The following year, he was cast in *Moments of Eighteen*, where he played the character of Jung Oh-je.[11]

msg.content:
Here are the birth dates of all current and former members of the South Korean boy band Astro:

### Current Members:
1. **MJ**: Born on March 5, 1994.
2. **Jinjin**: Born on March 15, 1996.
3. **Cha Eun-woo**: Born on March 30, 1997.
4. **Yoon San-ha**: Born on March 21, 2000.

### Former Members:
1. **Rocky**: Born on February 25, 1999.
2. **Moonbin**: Born on January 26, 1998.

### Members Born in March:
- MJ (March 5, 1994)
- Jinjin (March 15, 1996)
- Cha Eun-woo (March 30, 1997)
- Yoon San-ha (March 21, 2000)

Therefore, four members of Astro were born in March.

Here are the birth dates of all current and former members of the South Korean boy band Astro:

### Current Members:
1. **MJ**: Born on March 5, 1994.
2. **Jinjin**: Born on March 15, 1996.
3. **Cha Eun-woo**: Born on March 30, 1997.
4. **Yoon San-ha**: Born on March 21, 2000.

### Former Members:

msg.content:
Here are the birth dates of all current and former members of the South Korean boy band Astro:

### Current Members:
1. **MJ**: Born on March 5, 1994.
2. **Jinjin**: Born on March 15, 1996.
3. **Cha Eun-woo**: Born on March 30, 1997.
4. **Yoon San-ha**: Born on March 21, 2000.

### Former Members:
1. **Rocky**: Born on February 25, 1999.
2. **Moonbin**: Born on January 26, 1998.

### Members Born in March:
- MJ (March 5, 1994)
- Jinjin (March 15, 1996)
- Cha Eun-woo (March 30, 1997)
- Yoon San-ha (March 21, 2000)

Therefore, four members of Astro were born in March.
